meanings.definition: The position or office of a director.
meanings.sent1: Her directorship at the company allowed her to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The directorship of the organization changed hands after the annual meeting.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the directorship of the theater was comically portrayed by a clumsy actor.
meanings.sent4: The directorship of the team was like being the captain of a ship, guiding everyone towards success.
meanings.sent5: She took on the directorship with confidence and determination, leading the company to new heights.

meanings.definition: The term of office of a director.
meanings.sent1: His directorship lasted for five years before he decided to retire.
meanings.sent2: The directorship of the board typically lasts for a specific number of years.
meanings.sent3: During his directorship, the office saw many changes, including a new coffee machine.
meanings.sent4: The directorship of the committee was a whirlwind of meetings and decisions.
meanings.sent5: She approached her directorship with a sense of duty and responsibility, always putting the organization first.

meanings.definition: The function or position of a director.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the directorship of a company requires knowledge of leadership and management.
meanings.sent2: The directorship of the film allowed him to oversee the entire production.
meanings.sent3: His directorship of the project was like being the conductor of an orchestra, ensuring harmony among team members.
meanings.sent4: The directorship of the department involved making strategic decisions for the future.
meanings.sent5: She embraced the directorship as an opportunity to make a positive impact on the organization.
